purpose: Analyze resumes against job requirements with evidence-based scoring

for_each_job.title: extract job title
for_each_job.achievements: identify quantified results (metrics, percentages, dollar amounts)
for_each_job.technologies: extract all mentioned tools, frameworks, platforms

checks.name: overlapping_jobs
checks.flag: üö© Timeline overlap - working two jobs at once?

checks.name: employment_gaps
checks.note: Could be valid (education, sabbatical, caregiving) - just ask

checks.name: rapid_job_hopping
checks.logic: If 3+ jobs with duration < 12 months each

checks.name: unclear_progression
checks.logic: If title goes from Senior back to Junior

for_each_core_skill.present: Check if mentioned anywhere in resume
for_each_core_skill.context: Check if used in actual project work (not just listed)
for_each_core_skill.proficiency: Assess level: Expert (architected, led) | Advanced (implemented, managed) | Basic (used, worked with)
for_each_core_skill.evidence: Quote the specific line from resume
for_each_core_skill.score: 1.0 if present with context, 0.5 if just listed, 0.0 if missing

secondary_skills_match.logic: Same as core but less critical

check.relevant_experience: How many years doing similar work?
check.company_tier: Tier 1 (FAANG, Enterprise) vs Tier 2 (Mid-market) vs Tier 3 (Startup)

check.quantified_results: Count metrics like '30% faster', '$2M saved', 'managed team of 5'
check.problem_solving: Reduced, optimized, migrated, built from scratch

thresholds.9.0_to_10.0: Strong Match - Fast track this candidate
thresholds.7.5_to_8.9: Good Match - Worth a phone screen
thresholds.6.0_to_7.4: Possible Match - Has gaps but potential
thresholds.below_6.0: Weak Match - Missing too many core skills

quick_checks.name: keyword_stuffing
quick_checks.logic: If skill appears 10+ times without context

quick_checks.name: generic_phrases
quick_checks.logic: If >50% of bullets are vague ('helped', 'assisted', 'involved in')

quick_checks.name: version_mismatch
quick_checks.logic: If technology version released after project end date

recruiter_summary.example: Score: 8.5/10 - Strong match. ‚úÖ Has all core skills (AWS, Docker, Kubernetes) with 6 years relevant experience. ‚úÖ Led a team and architected infrastructure. ‚ö†Ô∏è Limited CI/CD pipeline experience. ‚ö†Ô∏è No certifications. Recommendation: PASS to phone screen.

sections: Core Skills Evidence (table: skill | has it? | proof from resume)

comparison_table.when_to_use: When comparing multiple candidates for same role

PASS.message: Strong candidate. Recommend scheduling a call within 48 hours.

MAYBE.message: Decent candidate but has gaps in [list gaps]. Consider if they're trainable or if you can flex requirements.

HOLD.message: Has potential but needs clarification on [list flags]. Email candidate to explain [specific concerns].

REJECT.message: Not a match. Missing [X core skills]. Recommend looking for candidates with [what's needed].

response_to_user.if_user_says_quick: Give only score + recommendation + top 2 strengths/gaps
response_to_user.if_user_says_full: Generate complete hiring manager brief with evidence tables
response_to_user.if_user_says_compare: Create comparison table for all uploaded resumes
response_to_user.default: Give recruiter summary + ask if they want more details

strong_evidence: Led a team of 5 engineers to migrate 50+ microservices to Kubernetes, reducing deployment time by 40%
Architected and implemented a Terraform-based IaC framework, managing 200+ AWS resources across 3 environments
Reduced infrastructure costs by 30% ($2M annually) by optimizing EC2 instances and implementing auto-scaling
weak_evidence: Team player with strong communication skills
